ApplySchema.name: ApplySchema
ApplySchema.documentation: Copies the input published schema into the Directory with the same name and version as that of the published schema .

AttachObject.name: AttachObject
AttachObject.documentation:
Attaches an existing object to another object. An object can be accessed in two ways:

  1. Using the path

  2. Using ObjectIdentifier

AttachPolicy.name: AttachPolicy
AttachPolicy.documentation: Attaches a policy object to a regular object. An object can have a limited number of attached policies.

AttachToIndex.name: AttachToIndex
AttachToIndex.documentation: Attaches the specified object to the specified index.

AttachTypedLink.name: AttachTypedLink
AttachTypedLink.documentation: Attaches a typed link to a specified source and target object. For more information, see Typed link.

BatchRead.name: BatchRead
BatchRead.documentation: Performs all the read operations in a batch.

BatchWrite.name: BatchWrite
BatchWrite.documentation: Performs all the write operations in a batch. Either all the operations succeed or none. Batch writes supports only object-related operations.

CreateDirectory.name: CreateDirectory
CreateDirectory.documentation: Creates a Directory by copying the published schema into the directory. A directory cannot be created without a schema.

CreateFacet.name: CreateFacet
CreateFacet.documentation: Creates a new Facet in a schema. Facet creation is allowed only in development or applied schemas.

CreateIndex.name: CreateIndex
CreateIndex.documentation: Creates an index object. See Indexing for more information.

CreateObject.name: CreateObject
CreateObject.documentation: Creates an object in a Directory. Additionally attaches the object to a parent, if a parent reference and LinkName is specified. An object is simply a collection of Facet attributes. You can also use this API call to create a policy object, if the facet from which you create the object is a policy facet.

CreateSchema.name: CreateSchema
CreateSchema.documentation:
Creates a new schema in a development state. A schema can exist in three phases:

  • Development: This is a mutable phase of the schema. All new schemas are in the development phase. Once the schema is finalized, it can be published.

  • Published: Published schemas are immutable and have a version associated with them.

  • Applied: Applied schemas are mutable in a way that allows you to add new schema facets. You can also add new, nonrequired attributes to existing schema facets. You can apply only published schemas to directories.

CreateTypedLinkFacet.name: CreateTypedLinkFacet
CreateTypedLinkFacet.documentation: Creates a TypedLinkFacet. For more information, see Typed link.

DeleteDirectory.name: DeleteDirectory
DeleteDirectory.documentation: Deletes a directory. Only disabled directories can be deleted. A deleted directory cannot be undone. Exercise extreme caution when deleting directories.

DeleteFacet.name: DeleteFacet
DeleteFacet.documentation: Deletes a given Facet. All attributes and Rules that are associated with the facet will be deleted. Only development schema facets are allowed deletion.

DeleteObject.name: DeleteObject
DeleteObject.documentation: Deletes an object and its associated attributes. Only objects with no children and no parents can be deleted.

DeleteSchema.name: DeleteSchema
DeleteSchema.documentation: Deletes a given schema. Schemas in a development and published state can only be deleted.

DeleteTypedLinkFacet.name: DeleteTypedLinkFacet
DeleteTypedLinkFacet.documentation: Deletes a TypedLinkFacet. For more information, see Typed link.

DetachFromIndex.name: DetachFromIndex
DetachFromIndex.documentation: Detaches the specified object from the specified index.

DetachObject.name: DetachObject
DetachObject.documentation: Detaches a given object from the parent object. The object that is to be detached from the parent is specified by the link name.

DetachTypedLink.name: DetachTypedLink
DetachTypedLink.documentation: Detaches a typed link from a specified source and target object. For more information, see Typed link.

DisableDirectory.name: DisableDirectory
DisableDirectory.documentation: Disables the specified directory. Disabled directories cannot be read or written to. Only enabled directories can be disabled. Disabled directories may be reenabled.

EnableDirectory.name: EnableDirectory
EnableDirectory.documentation: Enables the specified directory. Only disabled directories can be enabled. Once enabled, the directory can then be read and written to.

GetFacet.name: GetFacet
GetFacet.documentation: Gets details of the Facet, such as facet name, attributes, Rules, or ObjectType. You can call this on all kinds of schema facets -- published, development, or applied.

GetSchemaAsJson.name: GetSchemaAsJson
GetSchemaAsJson.documentation: Retrieves a JSON representation of the schema. See JSON Schema Format for more information.

GetTypedLinkFacetInformation.name: GetTypedLinkFacetInformation
GetTypedLinkFacetInformation.documentation: Returns the identity attribute order for a specific TypedLinkFacet. For more information, see Typed link.

ListDevelopmentSchemaArns.name: ListDevelopmentSchemaArns
ListDevelopmentSchemaArns.documentation: Retrieves each Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of schemas in the development state.

ListFacetNames.name: ListFacetNames
ListFacetNames.documentation: Retrieves the names of facets that exist in a schema.

ListIncomingTypedLinks.name: ListIncomingTypedLinks
ListIncomingTypedLinks.documentation: Returns a paginated list of all the incoming TypedLinkSpecifier information for an object. It also supports filtering by typed link facet and identity attributes. For more information, see Typed link.

ListIndex.name: ListIndex
ListIndex.documentation: Lists objects attached to the specified index.

ListObjectAttributes.name: ListObjectAttributes
ListObjectAttributes.documentation: Lists all attributes that are associated with an object.

ListObjectChildren.name: ListObjectChildren
ListObjectChildren.documentation: Returns a paginated list of child objects that are associated with a given object.

ListObjectParentPaths.name: ListObjectParentPaths
ListObjectParentPaths.documentation:
Retrieves all available parent paths for any object type such as node, leaf node, policy node, and index node objects. For more information about objects, see Directory Structure.

Use this API to evaluate all parents for an object. The call returns all objects from the root of the directory up to the requested object. The API returns the number of paths based on user-defined MaxResults, in case there are multiple paths to the parent. The order of the paths and nodes returned is consistent among multiple API calls unless the objects are deleted or moved. Paths not leading to the directory root are ignored from the target object.

ListObjectParents.name: ListObjectParents
ListObjectParents.documentation: Lists parent objects that are associated with a given object in pagination fashion.

ListObjectPolicies.name: ListObjectPolicies
ListObjectPolicies.documentation: Returns policies attached to an object in pagination fashion.

ListOutgoingTypedLinks.name: ListOutgoingTypedLinks
ListOutgoingTypedLinks.documentation: Returns a paginated list of all the outgoing TypedLinkSpecifier information for an object. It also supports filtering by typed link facet and identity attributes. For more information, see Typed link.

ListPolicyAttachments.name: ListPolicyAttachments
ListPolicyAttachments.documentation: Returns all of the ObjectIdentifiers to which a given policy is attached.

ListPublishedSchemaArns.name: ListPublishedSchemaArns
ListPublishedSchemaArns.documentation: Retrieves each published schema Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Returns tags for a resource. Tagging is currently supported only for directories with a limit of 50 tags per directory. All 50 tags are returned for a given directory with this API call.

ListTypedLinkFacetAttributes.name: ListTypedLinkFacetAttributes
ListTypedLinkFacetAttributes.documentation: Returns a paginated list of all attribute definitions for a particular TypedLinkFacet. For more information, see Typed link.

ListTypedLinkFacetNames.name: ListTypedLinkFacetNames
ListTypedLinkFacetNames.documentation: Returns a paginated list of TypedLink facet names for a particular schema. For more information, see Typed link.

LookupPolicy.name: LookupPolicy
LookupPolicy.documentation: Lists all policies from the root of the Directory to the object specified. If there are no policies present, an empty list is returned. If policies are present, and if some objects don't have the policies attached, it returns the ObjectIdentifier for such objects. If policies are present, it returns ObjectIdentifier, policyId, and policyType. Paths that don't lead to the root from the target object are ignored. For more information, see Policies.

PublishSchema.name: PublishSchema
PublishSchema.documentation: Publishes a development schema with a version. If description and attributes are specified, PublishSchema overrides the development schema description and attributes. If not, the development schema description and attributes are used.

PutSchemaFromJson.name: PutSchemaFromJson
PutSchemaFromJson.documentation: Allows a schema to be updated using JSON upload. Only available for development schemas. See JSON Schema Format for more information.

RemoveFacetFromObject.name: RemoveFacetFromObject
RemoveFacetFromObject.documentation: Removes the specified facet from the specified object.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: An API operation for adding tags to a resource.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: An API operation for removing tags from a resource.

UpdateFacet.name: UpdateFacet
UpdateFacet.documentation:
Does the following:

  1. Adds new Attributes, Rules, or ObjectTypes.

  2. Updates existing Attributes, Rules, or ObjectTypes.

  3. Deletes existing Attributes, Rules, or ObjectTypes.

UpdateSchema.name: UpdateSchema
UpdateSchema.documentation: Updates the schema name with a new name. Only development schema names can be updated.

UpdateTypedLinkFacet.name: UpdateTypedLinkFacet
UpdateTypedLinkFacet.documentation: Updates a TypedLinkFacet. For more information, see Typed link.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory where the object resides. For more information, see arns.

SchemaFacet.documentation: Identifiers for the facet that you are adding to the object.

ObjectAttributeList.documentation: Attributes on the facet that you are adding to the object.

ObjectReference.documentation: A reference to the object you are adding the specified facet to.

PublishedSchemaArn.documentation: Published schema Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that needs to be copied. For more information, see arns.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory into which the schema is copied. For more information, see arns.

AppliedSchemaArn.documentation: The applied schema ARN that is associated with the copied schema in the Directory. You can use this ARN to describe the schema information applied on this directory. For more information, see arns.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The ARN that is associated with the Directory. For more information, see arns.
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory where both objects reside. For more information, see arns.

ChildReference.documentation: The child object reference to be attached to the object.

LinkName.documentation: The link name with which the child object is attached to the parent.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory where both objects reside. For more information, see arns.

PolicyReference.documentation: The reference that is associated with the policy object.

ObjectReference.documentation: The reference that identifies the object to which the policy will be attached.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the directory where the object and index exist.

IndexReference.documentation: A reference to the index that you are attaching the object to.

TargetReference.documentation: A reference to the object that you are attaching to the index.

AttachedObjectIdentifier.documentation: The ObjectIdentifier of the object that was attached to the index.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the directory where you want to attach the typed link.

SourceObjectReference.documentation: Identifies the source object that the typed link will attach to.

TargetObjectReference.documentation: Identifies the target object that the typed link will attach to.

TypedLinkFacet.documentation: Identifies the typed link facet that is associated with the typed link.

Attributes.documentation: A set of attributes that are associated with the typed link.

TypedLinkSpecifier.documentation: Returns a typed link specifier as output.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema that contains the facet and attribute.

FacetName.documentation: The name of the facet that the attribute exists within.

Name.documentation: The name of the attribute.

AttributeKeyAndValue.documentation: The combination of an attribute key and an attribute value.

AttributeName.documentation: The attribute name of the typed link.

AttributeNameAndValue.documentation: Identifies the attribute name and value for a typed link.

SchemaFacet.documentation: Represents the facet being added to the object.

ObjectAttributeList.documentation: The attributes to set on the object.

ObjectReference.documentation: A reference to the object being mutated.

BatchAddFacetToObject.documentation: Represents the output of a batch add facet to object operation.

BatchAddFacetToObjectResponse.documentation: The result of a batch add facet to object operation.

ChildReference.documentation: The child object reference that is to be attached to the object.

attachedObjectIdentifier.documentation: The ObjectIdentifier of the object that has been attached.

SchemaFacet.documentation: A list of FacetArns that will be associated with the object. For more information, see arns.

ObjectAttributeList.documentation: An attribute map, which contains an attribute ARN as the key and attribute value as the map value.

ParentReference.documentation: If specified, the parent reference to which this object will be attached.

BatchReferenceName.documentation: The batch reference name. See Batches for more information.

ObjectIdentifier.documentation: The ID that is associated with the object.

BatchCreateObjectResponse.documentation: Represents the output of a CreateObject response operation.

ObjectReference.documentation: The reference that identifies the object.

BatchDeleteObjectResponse.documentation: Represents the output of a DeleteObject response operation.

ParentReference.documentation: Parent reference from which the object with the specified link name is detached.

BatchReferenceName.documentation: The batch reference name. See Batches for more information.

BatchDetachObjectResponse.documentation: Represents the output of a DetachObject response operation.

ObjectReference.documentation: Reference of the object whose attributes need to be listed.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

FacetFilter.documentation: Used to filter the list of object attributes that are associated with a certain facet.

Attributes.documentation: The attributes map that is associated with the object. AttributeArn is the key; attribute value is the value.

BatchListObjectAttributesResponse.documentation: Represents the output of a ListObjectAttributes response operation.

ObjectReference.documentation: Reference of the object for which child objects are being listed.

MaxResults.documentation: Maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

Children.documentation: The children structure, which is a map with the key as the LinkName and ObjectIdentifier as the value.

BatchListObjectChildrenResponse.documentation: Represents the output of a ListObjectChildren response operation.

Message.documentation: An exception message that is associated with the failure.

BatchReadException.documentation: The batch read exception structure, which contains the exception type and message.

ListObjectAttributes.documentation: Lists all attributes that are associated with an object.

ListObjectChildren.documentation: Returns a paginated list of child objects that are associated with a given object.

SuccessfulResponse.documentation: Identifies which operation in a batch has succeeded.

ExceptionResponse.documentation: Identifies which operation in a batch has failed.

BatchReadOperationResponse.documentation: Represents the output of a BatchRead response operation.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory. For more information, see arns.

Operations.documentation: A list of operations that are part of the batch.

ConsistencyLevel.documentation: Represents the manner and timing in which the successful write or update of an object is reflected in a subsequent read operation of that same object.

Responses.documentation: A list of all the responses for each batch read.

ListObjectAttributes.documentation: Lists all attributes that are associated with an object.

ListObjectChildren.documentation: Returns a paginated list of child objects that are associated with a given object.

BatchReadSuccessfulResponse.documentation: Represents the output of a BatchRead success response operation.

SchemaFacet.documentation: The facet to remove from the object.

ObjectReference.documentation: A reference to the object whose facet will be removed.

BatchRemoveFacetFromObject.documentation: A batch operation to remove a facet from an object.

ObjectReference.documentation: Reference that identifies the object.

ObjectIdentifier.documentation: ID that is associated with the object.

BatchUpdateObjectAttributesResponse.documentation: Represents the output of a BatchUpdate response operation.

AddFacetToObject.documentation: A batch operation that adds a facet to an object.

RemoveFacetFromObject.documentation: A batch operation that removes a facet from an object.

AddFacetToObject.documentation: The result of an add facet to object batch operation.

RemoveFacetFromObject.documentation: The result of a batch remove facet from object operation.

BatchWriteOperationResponse.documentation: Represents the output of a BatchWrite response operation.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory. For more information, see arns.

Operations.documentation: A list of operations that are part of the batch.

Responses.documentation: A list of all the responses for each batch write.

CannotListParentOfRootException.documentation: Cannot list the parents of a Directory root.

Name.documentation: The name of the Directory. Should be unique per account, per region.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the published schema that will be copied into the data Directory. For more information, see arns.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The ARN that is associated with the Directory. For more information, see arns.

Name.documentation: The name of the Directory.

ObjectIdentifier.documentation: The root object node of the created directory.

AppliedSchemaArn.documentation: The ARN of the published schema in the Directory. Once a published schema is copied into the directory, it has its own ARN, which is referred to applied schema ARN. For more information, see arns.

SchemaArn.documentation: The schema ARN in which the new Facet will be created. For more information, see arns.

Name.documentation: The name of the Facet, which is unique for a given schema.

Attributes.documentation: The attributes that are associated with the Facet.

ObjectType.documentation:
Specifies whether a given object created from this facet is of type node, leaf node, policy or index.

  • Node: Can have multiple children but one parent.

  • Leaf node: Cannot have children but can have multiple parents.

  • Policy: Allows you to store a policy document and policy type. For more information, see Policies.

  • Index: Can be created with the Index API.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The ARN of the directory where the index should be created.

OrderedIndexedAttributeList.documentation: Specifies the attributes that should be indexed on. Currently only a single attribute is supported.

IsUnique.documentation: Indicates whether the attribute that is being indexed has unique values or not.

ParentReference.documentation: A reference to the parent object that contains the index object.

LinkName.documentation: The name of the link between the parent object and the index object.

ObjectIdentifier.documentation: The ObjectIdentifier of the index created by this operation.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory in which the object will be created. For more information, see arns.

SchemaFacets.documentation: A list of schema facets to be associated with the object that contains SchemaArn and facet name. For more information, see arns.

ObjectAttributeList.documentation: The attribute map whose attribute ARN contains the key and attribute value as the map value.

ParentReference.documentation: If specified, the parent reference to which this object will be attached.

LinkName.documentation: The name of link that is used to attach this object to a parent.

ObjectIdentifier.documentation: The identifier that is associated with the object.

Name.documentation: The name that is associated with the schema. This is unique to each account and in each region.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see arns.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see arns.

Facet.documentation: Facet structure that is associated with the typed link facet.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The ARN of the directory to delete.
The ARN of the deleted directory.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Facet. For more information, see arns.

Name.documentation: The name of the facet to delete.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory where the object resides. For more information, see arns.

ObjectReference.documentation: A reference that identifies the object.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the development schema. For more information, see arns.
The input ARN that is returned as part of the response. For more information, see arns.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see arns.

Name.documentation: The unique name of the typed link facet.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the directory the index and object exist in.

TargetReference.documentation: A reference to the object being detached from the index.

DetachedObjectIdentifier.documentation: The ObjectIdentifier of the object that was detached from the index.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory where objects reside. For more information, see arns.

ParentReference.documentation: The parent reference from which the object with the specified link name is detached.

LinkName.documentation: The link name associated with the object that needs to be detached.

DetachedObjectIdentifier.documentation: The ObjectIdentifier that was detached from the object.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory where both objects reside. For more information, see arns.

ObjectReference.documentation: Reference that identifies the object whose policy object will be detached.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the directory where you want to detach the typed link.

TypedLinkSpecifier.documentation: Used to accept a typed link specifier as input.

Name.documentation: The name of the directory.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the directory. For more information, see arns.

State.documentation: The state of the directory. Can be either Enabled, Disabled, or Deleted.

CreationDateTime.documentation: The date and time when the directory was created.

Directory.documentation: Directory structure that includes the directory name and directory ARN.

DirectoryAlreadyExistsException.documentation: Indicates that a Directory could not be created due to a naming conflict. Choose a different name and try again.

DirectoryDeletedException.documentation: A directory that has been deleted and to which access has been attempted. Note: The requested resource will eventually cease to exist.

DirectoryNotDisabledException.documentation: An operation can only operate on a disabled directory.

DirectoryNotEnabledException.documentation: An operation can only operate on a directory that is not enabled.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The ARN of the directory to disable.
The ARN of the directory that has been disabled.
The ARN of the directory to enable.
The ARN of the enabled directory.

Name.documentation: The name of the Facet.

ObjectType.documentation: The object type that is associated with the facet. See CreateFacetRequest$ObjectType for more details.

FacetAlreadyExistsException.documentation: A facet with the same name already exists.

Name.documentation: The name of the facet attribute.

AttributeDefinition.documentation: A facet attribute consists of either a definition or a reference. This structure contains the attribute definition. See Attribute References for more information.

AttributeReference.documentation: An attribute reference that is associated with the attribute. See Attribute References for more information.

FacetAttribute.documentation: An attribute that is associated with the Facet.

DefaultValue.documentation: The default value of the attribute (if configured).

IsImmutable.documentation: Whether the attribute is mutable or not.

Rules.documentation: Validation rules attached to the attribute definition.

FacetAttributeDefinition.documentation: A facet attribute definition. See Attribute References for more information.

TargetFacetName.documentation: The target facet name that is associated with the facet reference. See Attribute References for more information.

TargetAttributeName.documentation: The target attribute name that is associated with the facet reference. See Attribute References for more information.

FacetAttributeReference.documentation: The facet attribute reference that specifies the attribute definition that contains the attribute facet name and attribute name.

Action.documentation: The action to perform when updating the attribute.

FacetAttributeUpdate.documentation: A structure that contains information used to update an attribute.

FacetInUseException.documentation: Occurs when deleting a facet that contains an attribute that is a target to an attribute reference in a different facet.

FacetValidationException.documentation: The Facet that you provided was not well formed or could not be validated with the schema.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The ARN of the directory.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Facet. For more information, see arns.

Name.documentation: The name of the facet to retrieve.

Facet.documentation: The Facet structure that is associated with the facet.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The ARN of the directory being retrieved.

ObjectReference.documentation: A reference to the object.

ConsistencyLevel.documentation: The consistency level at which to retrieve the object information.

SchemaFacets.documentation: The facets attached to the specified object.

SchemaArn.documentation: The ARN of the schema to retrieve.

Name.documentation: The name of the retrieved schema.

Document.documentation: The JSON representation of the schema document.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see arns.

Name.documentation: The unique name of the typed link facet.

IdentityAttributeOrder.documentation: The order of identity attributes for the facet, from most significant to least significant. The ability to filter typed links considers the order that the attributes are defined on the typed link facet. When providing ranges to typed link selection, any inexact ranges must be specified at the end. Any attributes that do not have a range specified are presumed to match the entire range. Filters are interpreted in the order of the attributes on the typed link facet, not the order in which they are supplied to any API calls. For more information about identity attributes, see Typed link.

ObjectIdentifier.documentation: The ObjectIdentifier of the object attached to the index.

IndexAttachment.documentation: Represents an index and an attached object.

IndexedAttributeMissingException.documentation: An object has been attempted to be attached to an object that does not have the appropriate attribute value.

InternalServiceException.documentation: Indicates a problem that must be resolved by Amazon Web Services. This might be a transient error in which case you can retry your request until it succeeds. Otherwise, go to the AWS Service Health Dashboard site to see if there are any operational issues with the service.

InvalidArnException.documentation: Indicates that the provided ARN value is not valid.

InvalidAttachmentException.documentation: Indicates that an attempt to attach an object with the same link name or to apply a schema with the same name has occurred. Rename the link or the schema and then try again.

InvalidFacetUpdateException.documentation: An attempt to modify a Facet resulted in an invalid schema exception.

InvalidNextTokenException.documentation: Indicates that the NextToken value is not valid.

InvalidRuleException.documentation: Occurs when any of the rule parameter keys or values are invalid.

InvalidSchemaDocException.documentation: Indicates that the provided SchemaDoc value is not valid.

InvalidTaggingRequestException.documentation: Can occur for multiple reasons such as when you tag a resource that doesnt exist or if you specify a higher number of tags for a resource than the allowed limit. Allowed limit is 50 tags per resource.

LimitExceededException.documentation: Indicates that limits are exceeded. See Limits for more information.

LinkNameAlreadyInUseException.documentation: Indicates that a link could not be created due to a naming conflict. Choose a different name and then try again.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The ARN of the directory you are listing.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

SchemaArns.documentation: The ARNs of schemas that are applied to the directory.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The ARN of the directory.

TargetReference.documentation: A reference to the object to that has indices attached.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

ConsistencyLevel.documentation: The consistency level to use for this operation.

IndexAttachments.documentation: The indices attached to the specified object.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to retrieve.
The maximum number of results to retrieve.

state.documentation: The state of the directories in the list. Can be either Enabled, Disabled, or Deleted.

Directories.documentation: Lists all directories that are associated with your account in pagination fashion.

SchemaArn.documentation: The ARN of the schema where the facet resides.

Name.documentation: The name of the facet whose attributes will be retrieved.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to retrieve facet names from.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

FacetNames.documentation: The names of facets that exist within the schema.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the directory where you want to list the typed links.

ObjectReference.documentation: Reference that identifies the object whose attributes will be listed.

FilterAttributeRanges.documentation: Provides range filters for multiple attributes. When providing ranges to typed link selection, any inexact ranges must be specified at the end. Any attributes that do not have a range specified are presumed to match the entire range.

FilterTypedLink.documentation: Filters are interpreted in the order of the attributes on the typed link facet, not the order in which they are supplied to any API calls.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

ConsistencyLevel.documentation: The consistency level to execute the request at.

LinkSpecifiers.documentation: Returns one or more typed link specifiers as output.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The ARN of the directory that the index exists in.

RangesOnIndexedValues.documentation: Specifies the ranges of indexed values that you want to query.

IndexReference.documentation: The reference to the index to list.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to retrieve from the index.

ConsistencyLevel.documentation: The consistency level to execute the request at.

IndexAttachments.documentation: The objects and indexed values attached to the index.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory where the object resides. For more information, see arns.

ObjectReference.documentation: The reference that identifies the object whose attributes will be listed.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ConsistencyLevel.documentation: Represents the manner and timing in which the successful write or update of an object is reflected in a subsequent read operation of that same object.

FacetFilter.documentation: Used to filter the list of object attributes that are associated with a certain facet.

Attributes.documentation: Attributes map that is associated with the object. AttributeArn is the key, and attribute value is the value.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory where the object resides. For more information, see arns.

ObjectReference.documentation: The reference that identifies the object for which child objects are being listed.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ConsistencyLevel.documentation: Represents the manner and timing in which the successful write or update of an object is reflected in a subsequent read operation of that same object.

Children.documentation: Children structure, which is a map with key as the LinkName and ObjectIdentifier as the value.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The ARN of the directory to which the parent path applies.

ObjectReference.documentation: The reference that identifies the object whose parent paths are listed.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

PathToObjectIdentifiersList.documentation: Returns the path to the ObjectIdentifiers that are associated with the directory.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory where the object resides. For more information, see arns.

ObjectReference.documentation: The reference that identifies the object for which parent objects are being listed.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ConsistencyLevel.documentation: Represents the manner and timing in which the successful write or update of an object is reflected in a subsequent read operation of that same object.

Parents.documentation: The parent structure, which is a map with key as the ObjectIdentifier and LinkName as the value.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory where objects reside. For more information, see arns.

ObjectReference.documentation: Reference that identifies the object for which policies will be listed.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ConsistencyLevel.documentation: Represents the manner and timing in which the successful write or update of an object is reflected in a subsequent read operation of that same object.

AttachedPolicyIds.documentation: A list of policy ObjectIdentifiers, that are attached to the object.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the directory where you want to list the typed links.

ObjectReference.documentation: A reference that identifies the object whose attributes will be listed.

FilterAttributeRanges.documentation: Provides range filters for multiple attributes. When providing ranges to typed link selection, any inexact ranges must be specified at the end. Any attributes that do not have a range specified are presumed to match the entire range.

FilterTypedLink.documentation: Filters are interpreted in the order of the attributes defined on the typed link facet, not the order they are supplied to any API calls.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

ConsistencyLevel.documentation: The consistency level to execute the request at.

TypedLinkSpecifiers.documentation: Returns a typed link specifier as output.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory where objects reside. For more information, see arns.

PolicyReference.documentation: The reference that identifies the policy object.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ConsistencyLevel.documentation: Represents the manner and timing in which the successful write or update of an object is reflected in a subsequent read operation of that same object.

ObjectIdentifiers.documentation: A list of ObjectIdentifiers to which the policy is attached.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource. Tagging is only supported for directories.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token. This is for future use. Currently pagination is not supported for tagging.

MaxResults.documentation: The MaxResults parameter sets the maximum number of results returned in a single page. This is for future use and is not supported currently.

Tags.documentation: A list of tag key value pairs that are associated with the response.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see arns.

Name.documentation: The unique name of the typed link facet.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

Attributes.documentation: An ordered set of attributes associate with the typed link.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see arns.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

FacetNames.documentation: The names of typed link facets that exist within the schema.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory. For more information, see arns.

ObjectReference.documentation: Reference that identifies the object whose policies will be looked up.

NextToken.documentation: The token to request the next page of results.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

PolicyToPathList.documentation: Provides list of path to policies. Policies contain PolicyId, ObjectIdentifier, and PolicyType. For more information, see Policies.

NotIndexException.documentation: Indicates that the requested operation can only operate on index objects.

NotNodeException.documentation: Occurs when any invalid operations are performed on an object that is not a node, such as calling ListObjectChildren for a leaf node object.

NotPolicyException.documentation: Indicates that the requested operation can only operate on policy objects.

ObjectAlreadyDetachedException.documentation: Indicates that the object is not attached to the index.

ObjectAttributeActionType.documentation: A type that can be either Update or Delete.

ObjectAttributeUpdateValue.documentation: The value that you want to update to.

ObjectAttributeAction.documentation: The action to take on the object attribute.

AttributeKey.documentation: The key of the attribute that the attribute range covers.

Range.documentation: The range of attribute values being selected.

ObjectAttributeKey.documentation: The key of the attribute being updated.

ObjectAttributeAction.documentation: The action to perform as part of the attribute update.

ObjectNotDetachedException.documentation: Indicates that the requested operation cannot be completed because the object has not been detached from the tree.

Selector.documentation:
A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. Path selectors start with a slash (/) and link names are separated by slashes. For more information about paths, see Accessing Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways:

  • $ObjectIdentifier - An object identifier is an opaque string provided by Amazon Cloud Directory. When creating objects, the system will provide you with the identifier of the created object. An objects identifier is immutable and no two objects will ever share the same object identifier

  • /some/path - Identifies the object based on path

  • #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call

ObjectReference.documentation: The reference that identifies an object.

Path.documentation: The path that is used to identify the object starting from directory root.

ObjectIdentifiers.documentation: Lists ObjectIdentifiers starting from directory root to the object in the request.

PathToObjectIdentifiers.documentation: Returns the path to the ObjectIdentifiers that is associated with the directory.

PolicyType.documentation: The type of policy that can be associated with PolicyAttachment.

PolicyAttachment.documentation: Contains the PolicyType, PolicyId, and the ObjectIdentifier to which it is attached. For more information, see Policies.

Path.documentation: The path that is referenced from the root.

PolicyToPath.documentation: Used when a regular object exists in a Directory and you want to find all of the policies that are associated with that object and the parent to that object.

DevelopmentSchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the development schema. For more information, see arns.

Version.documentation: The version under which the schema will be published.

Name.documentation: The new name under which the schema will be published. If this is not provided, the development schema is considered.

PublishedSchemaArn.documentation: The ARN that is associated with the published schema. For more information, see arns.

SchemaArn.documentation: The ARN of the schema to update.

Arn.documentation: The ARN of the schema to update.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The ARN of the directory in which the object resides.

ObjectReference.documentation: A reference to the object to remove the facet from.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: The specified resource could not be found.

RetryableConflictException.documentation: Occurs when a conflict with a previous successful write is detected. For example, if a write operation occurs on an object and then an attempt is made to read the object using SERIALIZABLE consistency, this exception may result. This generally occurs when the previous write did not have time to propagate to the host serving the current request. A retry (with appropriate backoff logic) is the recommended response to this exception.

Parameters.documentation: The minimum and maximum parameters that are associated with the rule.

Rule.documentation: Contains an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) and parameters that are associated with the rule.

SchemaAlreadyExistsException.documentation: Indicates that a schema could not be created due to a naming conflict. Please select a different name and then try again.

SchemaAlreadyPublishedException.documentation: Indicates that a schema is already published.

SchemaArn.documentation: The ARN of the schema that contains the facet.

StillContainsLinksException.documentation: The object could not be deleted because links still exist. Remove the links and then try the operation again.

Key.documentation: The key that is associated with the tag.

Value.documentation: The value that is associated with the tag.

Tag.documentation: The tag structure that contains a tag key and value.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource. Tagging is only supported for directories.

TypedAttributeValue.documentation: Represents the data for a typed attribute. You can set one, and only one, of the elements. Each attribute in an item is a name-value pair. Attributes have a single value.

StartValue.documentation: The value to start the range at.

EndValue.documentation: The attribute value to terminate the range at.

Name.documentation: The unique name of the typed link attribute.

DefaultValue.documentation: The default value of the attribute (if configured).

IsImmutable.documentation: Whether the attribute is mutable or not.

Rules.documentation: Validation rules that are attached to the attribute definition.

AttributeName.documentation: The unique name of the typed link attribute.

Range.documentation: The range of attribute values that are being selected.

TypedLinkAttributeRange.documentation: Identifies the range of attributes that are used by a specified filter.

Name.documentation: The unique name of the typed link facet.

Attributes.documentation: A set of key-value pairs associated with the typed link. Typed link attributes are used when you have data values that are related to the link itself, and not to one of the two objects being linked. Identity attributes also serve to distinguish the link from others of the same type between the same objects.

IdentityAttributeOrder.documentation: The set of attributes that distinguish links made from this facet from each other, in the order of significance. Listing typed links can filter on the values of these attributes. See ListOutgoingTypedLinks and ListIncomingTypeLinks for details.

TypedLinkFacet.documentation: Defines the typed links structure and its attributes. To create a typed link facet, use the CreateTypedLinkFacet API.

Action.documentation: The action to perform when updating the attribute.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see arns.

TypedLinkName.documentation: The unique name of the typed link facet.

TypedLinkSchemaAndFacetName.documentation: Identifies the schema Amazon Resource Name (ARN) and facet name for the typed link.

TypedLinkFacet.documentation: Identifies the typed link facet that is associated with the typed link.

SourceObjectReference.documentation: Identifies the source object that the typed link will attach to.

TargetObjectReference.documentation: Identifies the target object that the typed link will attach to.

TypedLinkSpecifier.documentation: Contains all the information that is used to uniquely identify a typed link. The parameters discussed in this topic are used to uniquely specify the typed link being operated on. The AttachTypedLink API returns a typed link specifier while the DetachTypedLink API accepts one as input. Similarly, the ListIncomingTypedLinks and ListOutgoingTypedLinks API operations provide typed link specifiers as output. You can also construct a typed link specifier from scratch.

UnsupportedIndexTypeException.documentation: Indicates that the requested index type is not supported.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource. Tagging is only supported for directories.

TagKeys.documentation: Keys of the tag that need to be removed from the resource.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Facet. For more information, see arns.

Name.documentation: The name of the facet.

AttributeUpdates.documentation: List of attributes that need to be updated in a given schema Facet. Each attribute is followed by AttributeAction, which specifies the type of update operation to perform.

ObjectType.documentation: The object type that is associated with the facet. See CreateFacetRequest$ObjectType for more details.

DirectoryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the Directory where the object resides. For more information, see arns.

ObjectReference.documentation: The reference that identifies the object.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the development schema. For more information, see arns.

Name.documentation: The name of the schema.

SchemaArn.documentation: The ARN that is associated with the updated schema. For more information, see arns.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see arns.

Name.documentation: The unique name of the typed link facet.

IdentityAttributeOrder.documentation: The order of identity attributes for the facet, from most significant to least significant. The ability to filter typed links considers the order that the attributes are defined on the typed link facet. When providing ranges to a typed link selection, any inexact ranges must be specified at the end. Any attributes that do not have a range specified are presumed to match the entire range. Filters are interpreted in the order of the attributes on the typed link facet, not the order in which they are supplied to any API calls. For more information about identity attributes, see Typed link.

ValidationException.documentation: Indicates that your request is malformed in some manner. See the exception message.

documentation:
Amazon Cloud Directory

Amazon Cloud Directory is a component of the AWS Directory Service that simplifies the development and management of cloud-scale web, mobile, and IoT applications. This guide describes the Cloud Directory operations that you can call programmatically and includes detailed information on data types and errors. For information about AWS Directory Services features, see AWS Directory Service and the AWS Directory Service Administration Guide.
